Release Info:  

Year: 2014
Genre: Strategy (Real-time) / 3D
Developer: Longbow Games
Publisher: Kasedo Games
Publication Type: RePack
Game Language:Eng | Rus
Voice Language: Eng
Crack: PLAZA



System Requirements:  

Operating system: Windows XP (32-Bit), Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8
Processor: Intel Dual Core 2,4 GHz / AMD Athlon X2 4200 +
Memory: 3 GB
Graphics card: GeForce 9600 GT / Radeon HD 3850
Sound Card: Sound device compatible with DirectX 9.0
Free space on hard drive: 3 GB

Game Information:  

Hegemony Rome: The Rise of Caesar - real time strategy game from the studio
Longbow Games, authors Hegemony Gold: Wars of Ancient Greece. In The Rise
of Caesar You play as Julius Caesar and try to defeat the barbarian tribes of ancient
Gaul. You will lead the legions of soldiers, build forts, walls and bridges, as well as
participate in battles, trying to defeat the enemy, not only brute force, but competent
and tactics. For example, you can crop the supply channel of the enemy camp,
thereby Zamora enemy soldiers hunger.

Game Features:  

Command on behalf of Julius Caesar - four campaigns highlight the conquest
of Julius Caesar, exactly as he described it in the Notes on the Gallic War.
Bridge over the Rhine, the invasion of Britain and the conquest of Gaul appear
in more than one hundred different tasks for the player, or choose from more
than twenty factions in the epic sandbox mode.

Completely new map - explore an area the size more than one million square
kilometers from the Mediterranean coast to the shores of Britain, where any
part can be easily approached and discussed in detail.

Superior graphics engine - Hegemony Rome: The Rise of Caesar supports 10
detalizirovanie multiple areas, compared with the previous parts of the series,
as well as different exciting and diverse landscape.

Empire building - building system allows the player to build forts, walls and bridges
on a thousand different places all over the map, to strengthen Roman rule
over the territory of the barbarians.

Improve your legions - the player can train commanders and assign them certain
skills to enhance performance units, as well as the player can appoint governors
and engage in construction of buildings and improve their city.


Repack Features:  
Hegemony Rome: The Rise of Caesar
